sentence.Network_en: She was overjoyed and rewarded the redcoat a goblet of wine, which he drank with relish.
sentence.Network_cn: 那女士高兴极了,奉酒一杯, 那英兵喝得津津有味.

sentence.Network_en: The court, clay, had come through its first winter pitted and windswept bare of redcoat.
sentence.Network_cn: 球场上的粘土经过第一个冬天以后, 变得坑坑洼洼,表面的红土都给风刮去了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: redbug 沙蚤redcoat 英国军人-
redcedar 红香柏, redcoat 红袄, redcliffe 雷德克利夫

list.abs: pursued the withdrawing redcoats ., 追击撤退的英国士兵.
...属于英国后，就出台了许多控制威士忌酿造的法律，形势变得复杂。酒厂的税率也各不相同，收税必须由被称为“红外套”（redcoats）的英国士兵伴随，“红外套”的名称是由他们穿的外套的颜色而来的。在那时，已有几个收税员丢掉了性命，收税.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (in sense 1): so named because of the colour of the uniform. Sense 2 dates from the 1950s

means.word_mean: 1. British soldier; so-called because of his red coat (especially during the American Revolution)

auth_sentence.content: Many of the song titles sound like they were conceived by a drunk Butlins Redcoat.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Many of the song titles sound like they were conceived by a drunk Butlins Redcoat.

auth_sentence.content: By the front door, a painted statue of a redcoat, the Revolutionary equivalent of a tobacco-store Indian, stands guard.
